https://lnkd.in/es5WGMNa Imagine a four-day work week that not only reduces stress but also benefits our environment, our children, and our well-being. A recent pilot program in Valencia, Spain, did just that, and the results are astonishing. Over 360,000 workers in Valencia experienced long weekends that encouraged healthier habits, like sports, relaxation, and homemade meals. The outcome? Improved self-perceived health, reduced stress, and an overall boost in happiness, mood, and personal satisfaction. But that's not all – fewer working days led to fewer cars on the road, resulting in better air quality and less pollution. The best part? Children thrived as their parents enjoyed an improved work-life balance. While this initiative was born out of Valencia's innovative spirit, it's exciting to see how a shorter workweek can have such a positive impact. Could this be the future of work? 🌍👨👩👦👦✨ Read the full story to find out more about this groundbreaking experiment in Spain. #HealthierHabits #Environment #Innovation

This is not news, but Spain is only now realizing it: 4 day work weeks boost morale, help improve worker's performance, health and work-life balance. These are just a few benefits that have been associated Those are just some of the benefits associated with reducing the work week from the regular 5 days to 4. On top of that, this also impacts the environment, as high traffic was prevented during one more day in the week, directly leading to less nitrogen dioxide being emitted by vehicles and consumed by Valencia's inhabitants, commuters and visitors. Not only was physical health improved, but mental health too. Having more time to spend in hobbies and leisure activities, such as reading, music, painting, photography... leads to less stress, which was in the end, as perceived by the people who participated in the outcome survey of this experiment, less tiredness, more happiness and a better overall mood. In conclusion, the four-day week is the quickest and healthiest measure for all companies who want improved performance and happier employees. https://lnkd.in/dAi8WFk8

🌞 Working Abroad: Is It All Sunshine and Roses? 🌞 For the past few years, I've had the pleasure of working from Spain during August. It certainly has its perks—who wouldn't enjoy taking conference calls with a scenic view or a quick dip during lunch? Having two kids with two full-time working parents certainly has its challenges when work is the priority. But, like anything, it comes with its drawbacks. I'd love to hear your thoughts on working from abroad. What do you think works and what doesn't? One question that's been on my mind: Do employees get annoyed when their bosses work remotely? Do they feel it's unfair? I run my own business, so I'm always on call, and work never truly stops, that's my decision and I not complaining. But empathy is crucial—ensuring everyone feels part of a cohesive team, regardless of location, is key. Interestingly, many clients are now encouraging employees to be in the office 4-5 days a week. Would this change make you consider looking for a new job? The shift back to full-time office work is significant, and I'm curious if it aligns with your current work-life balance. ✔️ Flexibility ✔️ Team Cohesion ✔️ Work-Life Balance #WorkLifeBalance #TechIndustry

🏞 Embracing the Workcation Philosophy 🏙 Workcation: the fusion of work and vacation We are currently soaking up the vibrant atmosphere of Buenos Aires during a two-week workcation. In contrast to our home in New York, it is late spring, 70-degree weather, sunny with a gentle breeze. Two hours ahead of New York, the slower mornings, relaxed pace, and late dinners seamlessly guide us into a more laid-back daily rhythm. Our four-legged "chief of staff" is reveling in her best life (yes, we brought Midge). This is actually our second workcation from Buenos Aires this year—an essential biannual retreat for two self-employed individuals in pursuit of means to mitigate burn-out and the elusive "work-life balance". The venue change has become a defining aspect of our personal brands. A full workday, even during the busiest season, becomes less taxing when set against a completely different backdrop. Mundane tasks evolve into mini-adventures, with leisurely walks for our dog that become opportunities to explore local shops or savor a coffee. Living in a different culture, rather than just touring through it, has opened our minds to diverse ways of living and working. With over a decade of workcation experience under our belts, here are some tips for a successful venue change: 🌎 Minimize disruption to the flow of a normal workday by choosing a location in a convenient time zone 🏖 Go where you can happily unwind without feeling pressured to engage in tourist activities 🔗 Ensure reliable WiFi and seamless connectivity with VPN and a local SIM card 🖥 Arrange sufficient space for a comfortable desk setup, especially if there is more than one person working from the same space 🦃 Time your workcation around a holiday or include some genuine work-free non-weekend days Admittedly, the embrace of the workcation philosophy isn't universal. It's not a substitute for a true vacation or PTO, and some argue it further blurs the lines between work and personal life. What are your thoughts on this controversial approach to work-life balance? Have you done a workcation, and if so of if not, where? Share your insights! 🌆 💼🏖️ #Workcation #RemoteWork #WorkLifeBalance #WanderingConsultant #DigitalNomad

If you could work anywhere, where would it be? I chose a sunny balcony in southern Italy 🌞🌊 I’m working from a balcony in the south of Italy, enjoying the breathtaking scenery while staying connected with my team. This is what flexible working is all about. Here are three lessons I’ve learned about flexible working: 🌍 Location Independence = Enhanced Creativity: Changing your surroundings can spark new ideas and perspectives. The serene views here have been a great source of inspiration! 👨💻 Work-Life Harmony: Flexibility allows us to integrate work into our lives more seamlessly. I’m celebrating personal milestones without compromising on professional commitments. 🤝 Trust and Accountability: Successful flexible working relies on mutual trust and clear communication. Our team thrives because we hold ourselves accountable and support each other, no matter where we are. Flexibility in the workplace is not just a trend; it’s a powerful shift towards a more balanced, productive, and fulfilling work life. Grateful for the opportunity to combine work and travel, and for a company that values flexibility and trust. And now, back to the pool! 🏊♂️ #FlexibleWorking #RemoteWork #WorkLifeBalance #DigitalNomad #FutureOfWork #Productivity #WellBeing #TeamSuccess
